description: A first course in statistical methods, this course addresses study design and its implications as
well as exploratory and inferential techniques for analyzing and modeling
data. Topics include exploratory graphics, descriptive techniques, randomization tests,
confidence intervals, and simple/multiple regression.  Offered each semester.  Enrollment limited
for seniors. STAT 110, SDS 172, and ECON 260 all provide an introduction to statistics
and students should not take more than one; they all can serve as a prerequisite for
